questions.text: What is the primary benefit of using functions in programming?
options: To make the program run faster
To reduce code repetition and improve modularity
To store large amounts of data

questions.text: A function must always return a value.
What is the difference between a function 'definition' and a 'call'?
options: A definition is where the function's code is written; a call is where it is executed
A call is where the function's code is written; a definition is where it is executed
A definition is for numbers; a call is for text

questions.text: What is a 'parameter'?
options: The actual value passed to a function when it is called
A variable listed in a function's definition that receives a value
The value that a function returns
A global variable accessible by all functions

questions.text: The code inside a function's body is executed as soon as the function is defined.
A function that is part of a class or object is often called a:
What is an 'argument'?
options: A variable declared inside a function
The actual data or value passed to a function when it is called

questions.text: A function can call another function.
What does a 'void' return type (or its equivalent) signify?
options: The function will return an error
The function returns a zero or null value
The function can return any data type

questions.text: What is a function 'signature'?
options: The block of code inside the function
A comment describing what the function does
The function's name and the number and type of its parameters
The line of code that calls the function

questions.text: Variables declared inside a function are accessible from anywhere in the program.
The process of a function calling itself is known as:
What is the purpose of the `return` keyword?
options: To start the execution of a function
To pass arguments to a function
To exit the function and send a value back to the caller

questions.text: The names of parameters in a function definition must match the names of the variables used as arguments in the function call.
Breaking a large problem down into smaller, manageable parts using functions is called:
A 'local variable' is a variable that is:
options: Declared within a function and is only accessible inside that function
Stored on a local computer instead of a server

questions.text: A function can accept multiple arguments.
Which of these is a primary reason to use methods in object-oriented programming?
options: To define the data or attributes of an object
To define the behavior or actions that an object can perform
To create a new instance of an object

questions.text: What happens after a `return` statement in a function is executed?
options: Execution control is passed back to the point where the function was called
The function restarts from the beginning

questions.text: A function that does not accept any arguments must be defined with empty parentheses `()`.
In the code `result = calculate(5, 10);`, `calculate` is the:
What is a 'built-in' function?
options: A function that the programmer writes from scratch
A function that is part of the programming language and is available for use without being defined
A function that only works with numbers

questions.text: The scope of a variable determines where it can be accessed in the code.
Why is it good practice to use functions for code that is used multiple times?
options: It makes the code longer and more complex
It avoids having to write the same code over and over again (DRY principle)
It is the only way to use variables

questions.text: If a recursive function doesn't have a 'base case' to stop the recursion, what will happen?
options: The function will return 0 by default
It will lead to an infinite recursion and likely a stack overflow error
The function will only execute once

questions.text: In many languages, functions are considered 'first-class citizens', meaning they can be treated like any other variable.
The part of the code that invokes or executes a function is the:
What is the term for defining multiple functions with the same name but different parameters?
A method in an object can access and modify that object's data (attributes).
